publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1050 Mr Jamie Stone: Access to Free Music Tuition—That the Parliament welcomes Gizzen Griggs, Tain Royal Academy’s youth band, notes with concern the decreasing number of local authorities who still offer free music lessons and believes that music tuition should be delivered free at source to all students across Scotland.
S1M-1050 Access to Free Music Tuition (lodged on 23 June 2000) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-1050 Access to Free Music Tuition (lodged on 23 June 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-1050 Access to Free Music Tuition (lodged on 23 June 2000) Robert Brown*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1050 Access to Free Music Tuition (lodged on 23 June 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-1050 Mr Jamie Stone: Access to Free Music Tuition—That the Parliament welcomes Gizzen Griggs, Tain Royal Academy’s youth band, notes with concern the decreasing number of local authorities who still offer free music lessons and believes that music tuition should be delivered free at source to all students across Scotland. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Robert Brown, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Dorothy-Grace Elder
S1M-1050 Access to Free Music Tuition (lodged on 23 June 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Brian Adam*
